thread.title: Oil Slips as U.S. Inventories Climb

author: Sarah McFarlane
title: Oil Slips as U.S. Inventories Climb
text:
Oil prices eased Thursday after a surprise rise in U.S. inventories, but geopolitical concerns which could tighten global supplies helped keep the market near 3½-year highs.
Brent crude, the global oil benchmark, was down 1% to $78.98 a barrel on London’s ICE Futures exchange having hit $80.50 last week, its highest level since November 2014. On the New York Mercantile Exchange, West Texas Intermediate futures were trading down 0.7% at $71.33 a barrel.
...
